section.title: form.select
section.para: This view helper generates a <select> dropdown list for the use with a form.

section.title: Basic usage
section.para: The most straightforward way is to supply an associative array as the "options" parameter.
The array key is used as option key, and the value is used as human-readable name.

example.title: Basic usage
example.programlisting: <f3:form.select name="paymentOptions" options="{payPal: 'PayPal International Services', visa: 'VISA Card'}" />

section.title: Pre-select a value
section.para: To pre-select a value, set "selectedValue" to the option key which should be selected.

example.title: Default value
example.programlisting: <f3:form.select name="paymentOptions" options="{payPal: 'PayPal International Services', visa: 'VISA Card'}" selectedValue="visa" />

section.para: Generates a dropdown box like above, except that "VISA Card" is selected.
If the select box is a multi-select box (multiple="true"), then "selectedValue" can be an array as well.

section.title: Usage on domain objects
section.para: If you want to output domain objects, you can just pass them as array into the "options" parameter.
To define what domain object value should be used as option key, use the "optionKey" variable. Same goes for optionValue.
If the optionKey variable is set, the getter named after that value is used to retrieve the option key.
If the optionValue variable is set, the getter named after that value is used to retrieve the option value.
In the above example, the userArray is an array of "User" domain objects, with no array key specified.
So, in the above example, the method $user->getId() is called to retrieve the key, and $user->getFirstName() to retrieve the displayed value of each entry.
The "selectedValue" property now expects a domain object, and tests for object equivalence.

section.title: if
section.para: This view helper implements an if/else condition.
Example:

section.title: Basic usage

example.programlisting: <f:if condition="somecondition"> This is being shown in case the condition matches </f:if>

section.para: Everything inside the <f3:if> tag is being displayed if the condition evaluates to TRUE.

section.title: If / then / else

example.programlisting: <f3:if condition="somecondition"> <f3:then> This is being shown in case the condition matches. </f3:then> <f3:else> This is being displayed in case the condition evaluates to FALSE. </f3:else> </f3:if>

section.para: Everything inside the "then" tag is displayed if the condition evaluates to TRUE.
Otherwise, everything inside the "else"-tag is displayed.
